result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica R Bruce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

May transfer supervision to Portage County.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use.
Participate in any counseling or treatments recommended by the agent.
**Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

records.addlTxt:
11:31 AM Defendant Jessica R Bruce in court with Attorney (Atty) Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jessica R Bruce in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed the DOC Revocation packet. No changes needed. 
ADA Zell states the victim was contacted and is not present today.
State recommends a prison sentence with 106 days credit and $518.00 still owed.
Atty Drengler recommends a jail sentence with huber, electronic monitor, and transfer from Wood Co to Portage County.
Court considers recommendations from the Parties and DOC.

BY THE COURT: Prison Sentence
18 months Incarceration and 18 months Extended Supervision, 106 days credit. 
May transfer supervision to Portage County.
Eligible for Substance and ERP programs.
Conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use.
Participate in any counseling or treatments recommended by the agent.
Pay costs.

Atty Drengler to go over the appeal rights form with his client.
Written Determinate is provided to the parties.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 14, 2018 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessica R Bruce in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-219 and 15CF-336.

10:23 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing hearing at this time.

15CF-336: Is being handled by Atty Cousins
15CF-319: Is being handled by Atty Constable

There is a plea agreement in these cases. Plea summary is presented to the Court.

In 15CF-336 Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
In 15CF-219 Defendant is pleading to Count 1.

Victim is present and would like to address the Court.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-336 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-219

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-336: Count 1: Found Guilty
15CF-336: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-219: Found Guilty

10:33 AM Ms. L.S. addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine for sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-336:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Supervision may be transferred to Wood County if Wood County will accept it
Conditions:
Perform 50 Hours of Community Service
Pay restitution, joint and several with co-defendants, in the amount of $850. Pay a minimum of $100 per month towards restitution
Write a respectful letter of apology to the victim, submit to agent within 30 days of today's date
No contact with Mr. and Mrs. S. unless contact is prior authorized by agent
Continue with drug court as required. Follow all conditions and requirements
Maintain full time employment
Participate in counseling as recommended by the agent
Pay costs
Pay the felony DNA surcharge of $250

15F-219:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to 15CF-336
Supervision may be transferred to Wood County if Wood County will accept it
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-336
Pay costs
Pay the felony DNA surcharge of $250

Court addresses Defendant regarding possession of firearms, no contact order and right of voting.
Court informs Defendant of right to appeal.

Defendant can contact her probation agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessica R Bruce in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
